contentrichtext.text: __notoc__ {{Infobox scientist |name = Ernesto Cesàro |image = ErnestoCesaro.jpg |image_size = |caption = |birth_date = {{birth date|1859|3|12}} |birth_place = [[Naples]], Italy |death_date = {{death date and age|1906|9|12|1859|3|12}} |death_place = [[Torre Annunziata]], Italy |residence = |citizenship = |nationality = [[Italians|Italian]] |ethnicity = |field = [[Mathematics]] |work_institutions = |alma_mater = |doctoral_advisor = |doctoral_students = |known_for = |influences = |influenced = |prizes = |religion = |footnotes = |signature = }} '''Ernesto Cesàro''' (March 12, 1859 – September 12, 1906) was an [[Italy|Italian]] [[mathematician]] who worked in the field of [[differential geometry]]. This is his most important contribution which he described in ''Lezione di geometria intrinseca'' (Naples, 1890). This work contains descriptions of curves which today are named after Cesàro.<ref>http://www.tgmdev.be/curvecesaro.php</ref> Cesàro was born in [[Naples]]. He is known also for his 'averaging' method for the summation of [[divergent series]], known as the [[Cesàro mean]]. ==Books by E.
